title: Facebook Ads Setup Guide
description: Complete step-by-step guide to setting up Facebook Ads from scratch

steps.title: Set up Facebook Business Manager
steps.description: Facebook Business Manager is required to run professional ads and track results properly.
steps.instructions: Go to business.facebook.com and click 'Create Account'. Enter your business name, your name, and business email. Click 'Submit' to create your Business Manager account.
tips: Use your business email, not personal
Have your business details ready
You can manage multiple ad accounts from one Business Manager

steps.title: Connect Your Facebook Page
steps.description: Your ads will run from this page, and people will click through to learn about you.
steps.instructions: In Business Manager, click 'Business Settings' → 'Accounts' → 'Pages' → 'Add'. If you have a page, claim it. If not, create a new page first on Facebook.
tips: Use a professional profile photo
Add a cover photo that represents your brand
Fill out all page information completely

steps.title: Create Ad Account
steps.description: This is where you'll create and manage all your ad campaigns.
steps.instructions: In Business Settings, go to 'Accounts' → 'Ad Accounts' → 'Add'. Choose 'Create a new ad account', name it, select your time zone and currency, then assign it to your Business Manager.
tips: Currency cannot be changed later, choose carefully
Use a descriptive name if you'll manage multiple accounts
Make sure timezone matches your business location

steps.title: Add Payment Method
steps.description: You need a valid payment method before running ads.
steps.instructions: Go to 'Payment Settings' in Business Manager. Click 'Add Payment Method' and enter your credit card or PayPal information. Facebook will charge you based on your ad spend.
tips: Use a business credit card for easier accounting
Set a spending limit if you want to control costs
Facebook bills either when you reach $25 or monthly

steps.title: Install Facebook Pixel
steps.description: The Pixel tracks conversions and helps optimize your ads.
steps.instructions: Go to Events Manager → Pixels → Create a Pixel. Name it, then add the pixel code to your website header. If using WordPress, Shopify, or Wix, use their integrations.
tips: Use Facebook Pixel Helper Chrome extension to verify installation
Set up custom conversions for specific actions
Allow 24-48 hours for data to start showing

steps.title: Define Your Campaign Objective
steps.description: Choose what you want your ads to achieve.
steps.instructions: Click 'Create' in Ads Manager. Choose from objectives like Awareness, Traffic, Engagement, Leads, App Promotion, or Sales. For beginners, start with 'Traffic' or 'Conversions'.
tips: Traffic objective: Best for driving website visits
Conversions: Best if you have Pixel installed and want sales
Engagement: Best for building awareness and social proof

steps.title: Set Campaign Budget
steps.description: Decide how much you want to spend on this campaign.
steps.instructions: Choose between Daily Budget (spend X per day) or Lifetime Budget (spend X total over campaign duration). Start with $10-20/day for testing.
tips: Start small and scale up what works
Daily budget gives you more control
Facebook needs at least 50 conversions/week to optimize effectively

steps.title: Define Your Target Audience
steps.description: Who do you want to see your ads?
steps.instructions: In the Ad Set section, select location, age, gender, and detailed targeting. Use interests, behaviors, and demographics to narrow down your ideal customer.
tips: Don't target too broadly (over 1M people) when starting
Don't target too narrowly (under 50K people)
Test different audiences in separate ad sets
Use Lookalike Audiences if you have existing customers

steps.title: Choose Ad Placements
steps.description: Where your ads will appear across Facebook's platforms.
steps.instructions: Choose 'Automatic Placements' (recommended for beginners) or 'Manual Placements' to select specific locations like Facebook Feed, Instagram Feed, Stories, etc.
tips: Automatic placements usually perform better
Mobile feeds get the most engagement
Remove Audience Network if you want more control
Create separate ads for Stories format

steps.title: Create Your Ad Creative
steps.description: Design the actual ad people will see.
steps.instructions: Choose ad format (Single Image, Video, Carousel, or Collection). Upload your image or video, write compelling primary text (125 characters or less recommended), add a headline (40 characters max), and include a clear call-to-action button.
tips: Use high-quality images (1080x1080 for feed, 1080x1920 for stories)
Keep text on images to less than 20%
Video ads often perform better than images
Test 3-5 different creatives to see what works
Bright, colorful images tend to stop the scroll

steps.title: Write Compelling Ad Copy
steps.description: The words that will convince people to click.
steps.instructions: Write clear, benefit-focused copy. Start with a hook, explain the benefit, include social proof if possible, and end with a strong call-to-action. Keep it conversational and authentic.
tips: Use emojis sparingly to add personality
Ask questions to increase engagement
Mention specific benefits, not just features
Create urgency with limited-time offers
Use 'you' and 'your' to make it personal

steps.title: Set Up Conversion Tracking
steps.description: Track what happens after someone clicks your ad.
steps.instructions: Choose which conversion event you want to optimize for (Purchase, Lead, Add to Cart, etc.). Make sure your Pixel is firing this event correctly. You can verify in Events Manager.
tips: Test your conversion events before launching
Set up a conversion window (1-day, 7-day, etc.)
Track multiple events to see the full customer journey

steps.title: Review and Publish Campaign
steps.description: Final check before your ads go live.
steps.instructions: Review all settings: budget, audience, placements, creative, and tracking. Click 'Publish' to submit your campaign for review. Facebook typically reviews ads within 24 hours.
tips: Double-check your website URL is correct
Make sure your landing page loads fast
Verify pixel is installed and working
Save your campaign settings as a template for future use

steps.title: Monitor Initial Performance
steps.description: Check how your ads are performing in the first 24-48 hours.
steps.instructions: Go to Ads Manager and look at key metrics: Reach, Impressions, CTR (Click-Through Rate), CPC (Cost Per Click), and Conversions. Don't make changes too quickly - give ads at least 3-4 days to optimize.
tips: Good CTR for most industries: 1-3%
If CTR is low, improve your creative
If CPC is high, try different audiences
Check frequency - if over 3, ad fatigue is setting in

steps.title: Optimize and Scale
steps.description: Improve results and increase budget for winning ads.
steps.instructions: After 5-7 days, analyze what's working. Pause underperforming ads, increase budget on winners by 20% every 3 days, and test new audiences. Create new ad variations to avoid fatigue.
tips: Don't increase budget more than 20% at once
A/B test one element at a time
Keep winning ads running, duplicate and test variations
Use automated rules to pause poor performers
Refresh creative every 2-3 weeks to combat ad fatigue
